alert.note: Alert for Grundy; La Salle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 9:47AM CST until February 25 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Illinois River at Morris affecting La Salle and Grundy Counties. For the Illinois River (Upper)...including Morris...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Illinois River at Morris. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Pine Bluff Road threatened west of IL-47 south of Morris. Dwight Road threatened south of Morris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.3 feet this evening. - Action stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected around 400 AM CST late tonight.
